str2: Cornelius, a centurion of the Roman army, stationed at Caesarea. Of Latin origin; Cornelius, a Roman.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To say, declare. Properly, the same as the base of phos and phaino; to show or make known one's thoughts, i.e. Speak or say.
Fourth. Ordinal from tessares; fourth.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A dwelling; by implication, a family.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To pray, pray for, offer prayer. From pros and euchomai; to pray to God, i.e. Supplicate, worship.
As far as, until, even to.
This; he, she, it.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Ninth. Ordinal from ennea; ninth.
Apparently a primary word; an 'hour'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From the same as lampas; radiant; by analogy, limpid; figuratively, magnificent or sumptuous.
Clothing, raiment, vestment, robe. From hennumi; dress.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
Neuter of a compound of en and a derivative of optanomai; in the face of.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
